intro: Phymatanthus, commonly known as the silky tree or velvetwood, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Fabaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, South America, and Southeast Asia. The plants are characterized by their smooth, often waxy bark and showy, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. Phymatanthus species typically grow as small trees or shrubs, and some are cultivated for their ornamental value. The genus includes several species, some of which are used in traditional medicine.
